TopicTitle: Question about the Do's and Don't's of Development Discussion

Articles.Content:
Just wondering on what isn't allowed to be talked about. I was looking through some of the file folders in my installation of KSP and saw something that really alludes to a future feature about private contracting that I haven't seen any discussion about. Would talking about something like this be considered against the rules? Or would I be okay talking about it?

Essentially, is talking about something that was data mined against the rules?

Warning!!! Spoilers in this thread!!! ( I think)

Edited December 11, 2014 by Baconation
giving warning for spoilers
Discussion of the files should be acceptable, but you can't post any code you find in there.

What did you find? Digging around files that are distributed with the game is fair, if it was meant to be hidden I'd think it would have been obfuscated.

Also: Welcome to the forums!
I also see no reason why it'd be against the rules. I have to say, I'm intrigued now.

Firstly, thanks for welcoming me to the forums. I've been visiting here for a loooooong time, but never have had the opportunity to join in discussions and such. I actually didn't think that this thread was my first post

Okay, so I saw that Agencies that offer contracts are going to have different mindsets, which will affect the types of contracts given by each agency.

For example... Commercial, Conglomerate, Hasty, Pioneering, Scientific, Kerbalminded.

Each mindset seems to have a specific quality, like offering contracts specifically to do something that has never been done before, or setting up conditions against losing Kerbals, or even completing the mission in a "Hasty" manner.

Also in there is a company that competes against companies we have a negative standing towards, and even companies that offer higher stake reputation gains or losses based on the success or failure of a mission.

So reputation will be specific to certain companies. You can be on the bad side of some, or the hero of others, and I think it will affect how much a contract from a company can provide if completed based on reputation with that specific company.

If this in anyway is a post not allowed, please forgive me being naÃƒÂ¯ve about the forum rules. I would not be offended of a moderator deleted this thread if it violates any sort of player/developer guidelines. Secondly, if this is being discussed elsewhere in the forums, just disregard this as a double post

Er, I think that's an already-implemented feature. Agencies are the companies that offer contracts, and they offer different ones based on your overall reputation and your history of completing contracts for them. I believe the different mindsets affects, as you suspect, the types of contracts offered.

Okay, I wasn't sure if it was something that was fully realized within the game yet. I was thinking the interface may change within the system to be more emphasizing on those mentalities for each agency. Seeing as the contract generation stories each are based differently on the type of mentality of each agency. Gamedata/Squad/Agencies is where I found this information. I've logged almost a thousand hours of playtime and had yet to see any elaboration in the game on those mentalities, or even something that mentions it in game on the UI, or within some sort of informative parameter. I think right now, the contract system is very basic, and with the implementation of the Fine Print mod, we will see a much more substantial contract system, that will hopefully include more information in-game about the mentalities of these agencies. I just think it may be too confusing for the player if it was something that was never visually implemented.
You could be right, they might be planning to make the underpinnings of the contract system more visible to the player. We'll have to wait and see, I guess.

Yep, much agreed that it's going to be a wait and see, but should be exciting to see if it is added or not. It should add a good feel to the whole contract system and really have the player focus on whether they want to be in good with certain companies and such. Just seems like it will create more of a personalization in each person's career save without really affecting craft files and such for sharing.
